title: Corruption-Robust Algorithms with Uncertainty Weighting for Nonlinear Contextual Bandits and Markov Decision Processes. (arXiv:2212.05949v2 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Despite the significant interest and progress in reinforcement learning (RL) problems with adversarial corruption, current works are either confined to the linear setting or lead to an undesired $\tilde{O}(\sqrt{T}\zeta)$ regret bound, where $T$ is the number of rounds and $\zeta$ is the total amount of corruption. en_tdlr: Proposed a corruption-robust algorithm with uncertainty weighting for nonlinear contextual bandits and Markov decision processes. This algorithm supports general function approximation and relies on the recently developed uncertainty-weighted least-squares regression from linear contextual bandits and a new weighted estimator of uncertainty for the general function class.
